entry.title: video: Add needs_detiling metadata and plumb through viz
entry.content:
Add a needs_detiling boolean field to VideoFrameMetadata and plumb its

value into overlay candidates. This is in support of using a Vulkan

image processor to detile and scale protected video frames on certain

SoCs.



Note that this CL should be a no-op, since this field isn't read anywhere. Follow-up CLs will add Vulkan detiling functionality.



Bug: b:251458823

entry.title: Add interfaces to library based on attributes in the IDL template
entry.content:
This CL introduces a `addToLibrary` list attribute in `BEGIN_INTERFACE`

for IDL templates. `addToLibrary` specifies the interfaces that should

be listed in the `library` section of the generated IDL. For instance:

* `"addToLibrary": ["user", "system"]` will add the `IInterfaceUser` and

the `IInterfaceSystem` to the `library` section.

* `"addToLibrary": ["", "user", "system"]` will add `IInterface`,

`IInterfaceUser` and `IInterfaceSystem` to the `library` section.

* `"addToLibrary": ["user"]` will add only `IInterfaceUser` to the

`library` section.



This CL reduces the chance for errors in having an interface defined but

not listed in the `library` section.



Bug: 1496516

Change-Id: Ibac02ace5883a05a9148cd094086792be434bfde

entry.content:
Since the placeholder icon for promise app has a fixed size of 24px

across app states, placeholder app icons had a smaller size. A

calculation to compensate for the size was attempted on

crrev/c/5191786 but was incorrectly merged causing no visible changes.



Now that we are revising the change, set the correct calculation in the

apps grid and in the shelf.

calculate the size of the icon to avoid further confusion.

entry.title: Fix an edge case with CameraVideoFrameHandler
entry.content:
The edge case might lead to unexpected behaviour. It happens when `Close()` function is called, then for some reason `camera_video_source_remote_` mojo becomes disconnected, leading to a call to `OnFatalErrorOrDisconnection()`. During `OnFatalErrorOrDisconnection()`, `camera_video_stream_subsciption_remote_` is reset, which would invoke the destructor of `CameraVideoFrameHandler`, while still in the middle of the function.



Change-Id: I9d72d7b8a0ac14fc6dd4aabdb765dcfe03d4f113

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5181880

Commit-Queue: Ahmed Moussa

Reviewed-by: Ahmed Fakhry

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248321}

entry.title: Raise discard ring contrast ratio for non-chrome refresh builds
entry.content:
Currently, the non-chrome refresh version of the discard ring uses a

color that was tentatively placed to ensure that the ring can be seen

over the tab background but falls below the minimum contrast ratio

of 3:1. A contrast ratio lower than 3:1 was selected so that it doesn't

become too dark and differ too much from the approved original refresh

version of the ring.



However, the refresh version of the ring was eventually changed to be a

darker color so that it meets the minimum visible contrast ratio. This

CL raises the discard ring's contrast ratio for non-refresh builds to

also meet the minimum visible contrast ratio and be GAR compliant.



Non-Chrome Refresh without fix:

- https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8W227GT2cYqiutd.png

- https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4UbRcLfJF8gz52E.png



Non-Chrome Refresh with fix:

- https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8q7oHRESBfbgixf.png

- https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7P9M6PSsBNAz65N.png



Fixed: 1493808

entry.title: Run Wallpaper Search's browser tests by suite.
entry.content:
When run as one suite, these browser tests are flaky on Linux Debug's builder. We're splitting them to avoid any timing issues and to better ascertain the culprit.



Also adds a `status` and/or a response to tests that trigger a submission to WallpaperSearchResult i.e. `...Promise.resolve({status: ..., results: ...})`. These tests await a handler response, and an improper handler response can lead to console errors and/or test failures.

entry.title: Fix a few castos 'all' compile failures
entry.content:
Notable exceptions include dependencies on mojom interfaces that are not

present without full_safe_browsing which is disabled in is_castos, a

direct instantiation of BluetoothAdapterCast (has pure virtuals) and

various linker errors.



These should be surmountable but require someone with more context to

start hacking away. Locally `autoninja -k 0 -C out/castos` has ~22 steps

that cannot complete after this change. This should be surmountable.



gn args used to discover these failures:



enable_cast_receiver = true

is_castos = true

is_component_build = true

symbol_level = 1

use_goma = true

entry.title: [NTP Quests] Support filtering clusters by the ranking score threshold
entry.content:
Original CLs listed below were reverted as there were crashes. This CL combines those reverted score threshold updates. Adds a feature param to vary the score threshold for showing history cluster modules. Also used that feature param to filter the clusters. Clusters are ranked by if their score is closer to -1 and not 0. This CL updates the tests to account for this. Additionally it does not reserve space for all clusters in ranker as some are filtered out. Make sure to not try to record metrics if there are no clusters.



This includes a reland of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5169411 and https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5189274

entry.title: Convert QueryResults to a simple struct instead of a vector of variants
entry.content:
In hindsight, working with QueryResults is too complicated. Replaces it

with a struct containing explicit optional and

optional fields. This also matches the semantics of

QueryResults better since the "vector" could only contain 1 of each

result type.



Also removes the ContainsResult() and AsResult() helpers. Instead, use:



* ContainsResult(result) ->

result.cpu_time_result.has_value()

* AsResult(result) ->

result.cpu_time_result.value()

* ContainsResult(result) ->

result.memory_summary_result.has_value()

* AsResult(result) ->

result.memory_summary_result.value()



Bug: 1471683

entry.title: media/gpu: GL Image Processor Vertex Shader Update
entry.content:
Previously the GL Image Processor vertex shader was setup with its

vertices hard coded. While this does work, it makes it tricky to

implement transposition or rotation on the vertices.



Updates the GL Image Processor to use a Vertex Array Object(VAO) and

Vertex Buffer Object(VBO) respectively to setup the vertices for the

Vertex Shader. Updates the vertex shader to use them as well.



Additionally updates the processor to support scaling and transposition and

modifies the vertices of the VBO accordingly if transposition

or scaling is necessary.



Test: Tested MM21 comparison on Asurada via the Image Processor Test.

Test: Ran the Video Encode Accelerator Tests cropping tests with the GL enabled.

Test: Tested with custom Video Encode Accelerator Test to crop both horizontally and vertically and scale the image by 2.



Bug: b:314827242

Change-Id: Ia45a18b42d35643bed5adddd0826400c09c7764d

entry.title: [CSC] Complete the implementation of SendWheel()
entry.content:
The application provides (x, y) coordinates of where it wants to deliver

the scroll event. These browser interprets those as referring to the

coordinate space defined by the last video frame the app could observe.



However, the render process associated with the capturer is unaware of

the coordinate space of the captured tab. Therefore, Blink translates

the absolute coordinates which the app supplied into relative

coordinates, where 0 is the leftmost/topmost pixel, and increasing

values up to (but not including) 1 refer to progressively further

pixels towards the right/bottom.



When these relative coordinates are received in the browser process,

they are translated into the actual coordinates over the captured

surface based on its size, and the synthetic scroll event is produced in

the desired location.



Note that in the unlikely event that the resolution or aspect ratio

changes concurrently with the application's call to SendWheel(), the

scroll event will be delivered at a different location than the app

might have intended. The same problem is experienced when users try to

interact with a page directly while its layout changes. It therefore

does not require special handling - we let the issue be.



Bug: 1466247

Change-Id: I9d28f02eb40bca2d198f3629dbe94cf26fea04db

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5190733

Reviewed-by: Tom Sepez

Reviewed-by: Tove Petersson

entry.title: welcome tour: Add quantized interaction times prefs
entry.content:
In order to record the new metrics, which may be set before or after the

existing interaction metrics in some cases, we need a separate pref to

track their statuses. This adds the pref, and makes public accessors for

both the new prefs and old time prefs, since they'll be needed in the

logic for the new metrics.



Additionally, storing the new enum as a pref necessitates a new

`base::EnumSet` for safety.



The following WIP CL contains a rough draft of the full change for

additional context:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5090983

entry.title: Respect paused state when processing queued encodes
entry.content:
AudioTrackMojoEncoder may enqueue encode requests that arrive while it's

waiting for the encoder implementation to initialize. At the same time,

AudioTrackMojoEncoder is supposed to ignore encode requests arriving

while it's in the "paused" state.



This fix causes the processing of the queued encodes, which happens upon

finishing initialization, to respect the original "paused" state: If an

encode request was queued, it means it arrived while we were "unpaused",

thus we should process it regardless of the current "paused" state.



Fixed: 1518822

Change-Id: I4c1cee1e243fc1eb29d6eb24bcf832a27547d5ac

entry.title: [omnibox] Fix dcheck history fuzzy provider
entry.content:
Fuzzy provider sources matches from the history and bookmark providers.

It has to overwrite the `match.provider` to point to the fuzzy provider

instead of the history & bk providers.



There was a dangling raw_ptr crash caused by overwriting

`match.provider` after the fuzzy provider's local history & bk providers

were out of scope.



crrev.com/c/5185275 fixed the dangling raw_ptr crash by moving the

overwrite to before the providers became out of scope. But it introduced

a dcheck crash by moving the overwrite before the fuzzy provider counted

which provider sourced how many matches.



This CL moves the overwrite after the counting but before the providers

go out of scope.



Bug: 1446392, 1517427

Change-Id: I6af35fc4a3c0021648ef07eccc7a5dff4ec07c2c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5203025

entry.title: Add MaybeDoneWithNavigation in AttributionDataHostManager
entry.content:
Introduce a `MaybeDoneOnNavigation` method. This extracts some logic out

of `MaybeBindDeferredReceivers`. This change makes the behavior from the

caller perspective clearer. It also will make it easier for a follow up

CL that buffers OS registrations until we're done with a navigation.



Also change logic to indicate that the background registration is tied

to the navigation only after the registration is inserted to avoid an

inaccurate state where all expected registrations are tied and they are

no ongoing registrations tied to the navigation.

entry.title: Reland "[ios] Avoid unnecessary copies when using TabsCloser"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 107192cd2a5aa869fda7872a88af58cfed859a91



The original CL caused a failure in SessionRestorationService if

SaveSessions() or ScheduleSaveSessions() were called after attaching

a backup Browser since SessionRestorationBrowserAgent are not created

for backup Browsers.



Add a fix in those two methods to check for null and update the unit

test LegacySessionRestorationServiceTest.AttachBackup to call the two

methods after attaching the backup Browser.



Original change's description:

> [ios] Avoid unnecessary copies when using TabsCloser

>

> Add a notion of "backup Browser" to SessionRestorationService. This

> corresponds to a Browser where WebState can be moved without needing

> to copy the data.

>

> This is useful to implements TabsCloser when using the optimised

> session storage as there is no need to copy the state of unrealized

> WebState when moved to the backup Browser.

>

> This avoid doubling the storage needed to implement TabsCloser with

> the optimised session storage, reduce the amount of IO request and

> thus will allow explicitly saving the session after closing all the

> tabs (and after undoing the operation too).

>

> Bug: 1510953, 1383087

entry.title: Revert "Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 02c439796393e29c28763c1272ca112cde4c6747.



Reason for revert: Libfuzzer Upload Chrome OS ASan experiencing compile failures, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Libfuzzer%20Upload%20Chrome%20OS%20ASan/107898/overview



Original change's description:

> Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo

>

> The original idea was to retrieve all the attributes at once

> because that can be done efficiently with the PKCS#11 interface.

> Unfortunately in cases when the size of attributes is not known and

> they can be missing, this doesnt actually work well. E.g. if one

> attribute was never set and the provided buffer for another one is

> too small, the PKCS#11 interface can just return that some attributes

> are missing and then the caller has to retry with a different set

> of attributes to check that the buffer is too small error was

> not hidden by the attribute is missing one.

> So for custom attributes that are often never set its easier to

> retrieve them separately.

>

> Introduce GetKeyPermissions and GetCertProvisioningProfileId and

> refactor the existing code to implement them.

>

> Bug: b:287015636

> Test: *Kcer* unit tests

entry.title: Fix use-after-free in DrawTextInternal
entry.content:
DrawTextInternal was calling GetOrCreatePaintCanvas multiple times,

once at the start of the function, once inside of the

BaseRenderingContext2DAutoRestoreSkCanvas helper class and once in the

Draw call. GetOrCreatePaintCanvas destroys the canvas resource provider

if the GPU context is lost. If this happens on the second call to

GetOrCreatePaintCanvas, destroying the resource provider will

invalidate the cc::PaintCanvas returned by the first call to

GetOrCreatePaintCanvas.



The GPU process can technically crash at any point during the renderer

process execution (perhaps because of something another renderer

process did). We therefore have to assume that any call to

GetOrCreatePaintCanvas can invalidate previously returned

cc::PaintCanvas.



Change-Id: Ifa77735ab1b2b55b3d494f886b8566299937f6fe

Fixed: 1511567

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Add OOPIF param to existing bfcache PDF tests
entry.content:
Add an OOPIF param to existing bfcache PDF tests so that the PDF tests

run both with OOPIF PDF viewer and GuestView PDF viewer.



The bfcache PDF tests are already parameterized, so add new classes that

can handle the existing params and the new OOPIF param. Any tests that

do not need the OOPIF param can remain as-is.



Because the OOPIF param enables a feature flag, modify

ChromeBackForwardCacheBrowserTest::SetupFeaturesAndParameters() to be

able to enable/disable its original flags and the OOPIF PDF viewer

feature flag.



Tests that fail with OOPIF enabled are skipped for now and will be

enabled in the future.



The changes listed above are temporary and will be reversed in the

future once the PDF viewer fully migrates to OOPIF only.

entry.title: [Printing] Report number of pages together with the flattened pdf
entry.content:
Currently the print job controller sets page_count = 1 for all print

jobs originating from APIs (chrome.printing & Web Printing). As a

result, the number of pages is reported incorrectly in both

* Printing Notifications: "1 page to [printer-name]"

* Print Jobs App on ChromeOS: "Printing 1/1"



This CL addresses the issue by bundling the number of pages obtained

during pdf flattening together with the flattened data and returning it

to the controller.

entry.title: NavigationPredictor: Fix metrics recording in the presence of cross-origin iframes
entry.content:
Currently, the metrics collection in the renderer assumes that

whether an iframe is cross-origin can be determined by whether the

frame is in process. This is incorrect. This wasn't caught by tests

because the existing PageWithCrossOriginIframe test does not run

on android where the process model is different from desktop and the

test server is not set up correctly, so it's actually testing an error

page in the iframe.



We now lookup the AnchorElementMetricsSender for an anchor element

based on the main frame's document if it's same-origin, instead of

whatever the top-most in-process document is. We also update the

computation of several of the metrics to use the correct document.



We remove `source_url` from the computed metrics as this information

is already available to the browser as the sending RFH's

last committed URL.



Some text related metrics appear to have been accidentally omitted

for anchors in iframes. They're now included.



For the tests, we parameterize them on whether to enable site

isolation, to ensure that the logic does not change based on the

process model. We also add coverage for a A(B(A)) frame hierarchy

where we have a subframe that is same-origin to the main frame, but

also a local root.



Bug: 1502909

Change-Id: Iefa69d99eab8900eda6508f220f6314290262c2c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5038653

entry.title: [Android TRM] Add data provider with implementation using ForeignSession.
entry.content:
The Tab Resumption Module draws X-device data from Chrome sync. For the

Android MVP, it suffices to follow the "Recent Tabs" feature and use

ForeignSession.



To accommodate future optimization and mixing with local tabs, we define

a "data provider" abstraction (TabResumptionDataProvider) that the TRM

can use to fetch suggestions asynchronously. The main implementation

(ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider) uses ForeignSession.



X-device data is available only for signed in user with sync enabled. If

these statuses change, then the TRM UI should react accordingly (e.g.,

hide itself, or beyond MVP, only show local tabs). To support this, the

data provider takes a "status changed callback" to notify UI. Thus

ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider can listen to signin / sync

status changes, and request TRM UI to update.



Note: Suppose the TRM is never shown due to user being not signed

in and synced. If the user then signs in and enables sync, the NTP /

Start Surface is expected to reload; thus we don't need to handle this

scenario explicitly.



Details:

* Add TabResumptionDataProvider:

* Add abstract fetchSuggestions().

* Add setStatusChangedCallback().

* Add ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider:

* fetchSuggestions(): Passes null if not signed in or sync is off;

else visits all tabs over all windows over all foreign sessions,

then filters (recency limit 24h, and http: / https:) and ranks.

* Listens to signin state and sync status, and dispatches

StatusChangedCallback on change.



Also add ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProviderTest with 3 tests.



Bug: 1515325

Change-Id: I5d4ee6a3673b5d54b25787a78425a11f486cb166

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5202188

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: [bookmarks] Handle moves across storage/UUID-type boundaries
entry.content:
When a bookmark node is moved, its UUID may need to be indexed

differently, if NodeTypeForUuidLookup changed. It means that the

indexed entry needs to be moved from one UUID index to another, both

within the same BookmarkModel.



In Sync code, namely components/sync_bookmarks, this kind of move

manifests itself differently: as BookmarkModelView involves only a

subset of all existing permanent folders, these changes influence

the 'syncability' of a node as represented by

BookmarkModelView::IsNodeSyncable(). That is, a node that was

previously syncable may no longer be or the opposite.



Each of these two transitions needs handling:

1) For newly-syncable nodes, a creation needs to be propagated to the

server, as if a new bookmark was created locally.

2) For no-longer-syncable nodes, a deletion needs to be propagated to

the server, is if the bookmark was deleted locally.



Design doc (sorry, Googlers only):

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i9XuP0lXOvEbvlwXre-EXMum4dxs_UToCsCcImIPEQU/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-1t7DIB0kTwaaGMmxtiZLqw



Change-Id: I6e11236d32d4faf07c47f0d85b29386040d3d41d

Bug: 1494120

entry.title: [//gpu] Introduce RASTER_{READ, WRITE} SharedImage usage
entry.content:
This CL enables replacing SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_RASTER with RASTER_READ and

RASTER_WRITE by introducing the latter two as new SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE

enum values. To enable incrementally migrating clients, this CL also

adds SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_RASTER as a constant that is equal to

READ | WRITE.



In followup CLs we will:

- Incrementally convert all clients to pass READ | WRITE explicitly

- Convert service-side usage of SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_RASTER and eliminate

the constant

- Incrementally go through clients removing READ and/or WRITE usages

that are not necessary
